p.s: This wikiHow teaches you how to change the email address that you use to sign in to iCloud , the iTunes Store , and across Apple devices and services .
If your Apple ID ends in @mac.com , @me.com , or @iCloud.com , it cannot be changed .

item.s: Sign out of Apple ID .
Do so on all devices and services , such as iCloud and iTunes , that you 're signed into with your current Apple ID .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 1 Version 2.jpg

item.s:
Go to
the Apple ID website
.
Do so by clicking the link to the left or by typing appleid.apple.com in the search field of any Internet-connected Web browser .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 2 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Enter your current Apple ID and password in the labeled fields .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 3 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Click on or tap ➲ .
It 's on the right side of the " Password " field .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 4 Version 2.jpg

item.s: If you have two-step verification enabled , tap or click on " Allow " on another device , then enter the six-digit code in the spaces on the screen .
Click on or tap .
It 's a blue link on the right side of the screen under the " Account " section .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 5 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Click on or tap .
It 's next to the email address under the " APPLE ID " section at the top of the window .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 6 Version 2.jpg

item.s: If your Apple ID ends in @mac.com , @me.com , or @iCloud.com , you will not see this option .
Enter a new email address .
Use an address that 's neither already associated with an Apple ID nor likely to change soon .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 7 Version 2.jpg

item.s: If prompted , answer the security questions you set up with your Apple ID .
Click on or tap .
Apple will send an email with a verification code to your new email address .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 8 Version 2.jpg

item.s:
The button may read
Continue
, depending on the browser you 're using .
Check your email .
Look for the message sent by Apple .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 9 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Enter the verification code .
Type the code from the email message in the spaces that appear in the browser window .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 10 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Sign in with your new Apple ID .
You can now sign back in to your devices and Apple services with your new Apple ID .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 11 Version 2.jpg

item.s: If you have two-step verification enabled , tap or click on " Allow " on another device , then enter the six-digit code in the spaces on the screen .

head.s: Using iPhone or iPad Running iOS 10.3

item.s: Sign out of Apple ID .
Do so on all devices and services , such as iCloud and iTunes , that you 're signed into with your current Apple ID , EXCEPT the device you 're using to change your Apple ID .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 12 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Open Settings .
It 's a gray app with gears ( ⚙️ ) that 's typically located on your home screen .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 13 Version 2.jpg

item.s: Tap your Apple ID .
It 's the section at the top of the screen that contains your name and image , if you 've added one .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 14.jpg

item.s: Tap .
It 's at the top of the first section .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 15.jpg

item.s: Tap .
It 's a blue link on the right side of the screen next to " REACHABLE AT .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 16.jpg

item.s: Swipe left on your current Apple ID .
It 's the first email address in the list , with the words " Apple ID " in small text just below it .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 17.jpg

item.s:
On some devices , you may need to tap a "
-
" next to the email address rather than swiping left .
If your Apple ID ends in @mac.com , @me.com , or @iCloud.com , you will not be able to swipe left .
Tap .
It 's a red button to the right of your Apple ID .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 18.jpg

item.s: Tap .
You 'll be prompted to choose another email address already associated with your Apple ID , if there is one , or to enter a new email address .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 19.jpg

item.s: Enter a new email address .
Use an address that 's neither already associated with an Apple ID nor likely to change soon .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 20.jpg

item.s: If prompted , answer the security questions you set up with your Apple ID or your Apple ID password .
Click on .
Apple will send an email with a verification code to your new email address .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 21.jpg

item.s: Check your email .
Look for the message sent by Apple .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 22.jpg

item.s: Enter the verification code .
Type the code from the email message in the spaces that appear on your device 's screen .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 23.jpg

item.s: Sign in with your new Apple ID .
You can now sign back in to your devices and Apple services with your new Apple ID .

figure.rend: Change Your Apple ID Step 24.jpg

item.s: If you have two-step verification enabled , tap or click on " Allow " on another device , then enter the six-digit code in the spaces on the screen .
Apple recommends you use your primary email address for your Apple ID .
